buginformation.summary: Add tests for alter table exchange partition
Data size may be estimated as 0 if no columns are being projected after an operator
buginformation.description: in those cases we still emit rows.. but they may not have any columns within it. We shouldn't estimate 0 data size in such cases.

buginformation.summary: FS.deleteOnExit holds references to _tmp_space.db files
LLAP IF: when using LLAP IF from multiple threads in secure cluster, tokens can get mixed up
Set HIVE_TRANSACTIONAL_TABLE_SCAN to the correct job conf for FetchOperator
handle SKEWED BY for MM tables
handle writing to dynamic partitions
handle ctas for the MM tables
Lineage information not set properly
buginformation.description: I am trying to fetch column level lineage after a CTAS query in a Post Execution hook in Hive. Below are the queries:create table t1(id int, name string);create table t2 as select * from t1;The lineage information is retrieved using the following sample piece of code:lInfo = hookContext.getLinfo()for(Map.Entry<LineageInfo.DependencyKey, LineageInfo.Dependency> e : lInfo.entrySet()) { System.out.println("Col Lineage Key : " + e.getKey()); System.out.println("Col Lineage Value: " + e.getValue());}The Dependency field(i.e Col Lineage Value) is coming in as null.

buginformation.summary: Fix comments after HIVE-14350
buginformation.description: there are still some comments in the code that should've been updated in HIVE-14350

buginformation.summary: Add new unit tests
buginformation.description: Moving bunch of tests from system test to hive unit tests to reduce testing overhead

buginformation.summary: Add an option to skip log collection for successful tests
buginformation.description: We generate multiple gigs of tests at the moment. An option to skip log collection for successful tests could be useful.NO PRECOMMIT TESTS

buginformation.summary: Be able to modify a partition's fileformat and file location information.
Add UDF to allow interrogation of uniontype values
buginformation.description: OverviewAs stated in the documention:UNIONTYPE support is incomplete The UNIONTYPE datatype was introduced in Hive 0.7.0 (HIVE-537), but full support for this type in Hive remains incomplete. Queries that reference UNIONTYPE fields in JOIN (HIVE-2508), WHERE, and GROUP BY clauses will fail, and Hive does not define syntax to extract the tag or value fields of a UNIONTYPE. This means that UNIONTYPEs are effectively look-at-only.It is essential to have a usable uniontype. Until full support is added to Hive users should at least have the ability to inspect and extract values for further comparison or transformation.ProposalI propose to add a GenericUDF that has 2 modes of operation. Consider the following schema and data that contains a union:Schema:struct<field1:uniontype<int,string>>Query:hive> select field1 from thing;{0:0}{1:"one"}Explode to StructThis method will recursively convert all unions within the type to structs with fields named tag_n, n being the tag number. Only the tag_* field that matches the tag of the union will be populated with the value. In the case above the schema of field1 will be converted to:struct<tag_0:int,tag_1:string>hive> select extract_union(field1) from thing;{"tag_0":0,"tag_1":null}{"tag_0":null,"tag_1":one}hive> select extract_union(field1).tag_0 from thing;0nullExtract the specified tagThis method will simply extract the value of the specified tag. If the tag number matches then the value is returned, if it does not, then null is returned.hive> select extract_union(field1, 0) from thing;0null

buginformation.summary: fix arglist logging in schematool
buginformation.description: In DEBUG mode schemaTool prints the password to log file.This is also seen if the user includes --verbose option.

buginformation.summary: Remove cycles created due to semi join branch and map join Op on same operator pipeline
buginformation.description: If a semi join branch and map join operator are on same operator pipeline, then there could be a cycle created. Where the other map feeding into the mapjoin operator is waiting for the semi join branch to finish causing a cycle.

buginformation.summary: Support bracketed comments
buginformation.description: C-style comments are in the SQL spec as well as supported by all major DBs. The are useful for inline annotation of the SQL. We should have them too.Example:select/*+ MAPJOIN(a) */ /* mapjoin hint */a /* column */from foo join bar;

buginformation.summary: Semijoin removed in case of dynamically partitioned hash join
buginformation.description: Incase of dynamically partitioned hash join, the semijoin branch is removed to avoid a cycle even though it does not create a cycle.

buginformation.summary: Add blobstore tests for import/export
buginformation.description: This patch covers ten separate tests testing import and export operations running against blobstore filesystems: Import addpartition blobstore -> file file -> blobstore blobstore -> blobstore blobstore -> hdfs import/export blobstore -> file file -> blobstore blobstore -> blobstore (partitioned and non-partitioned) blobstore -> HDFS (partitioned and non-partitioned)

buginformation.summary: Compute table stats when user computes column stats
Add blobstore tests for CTAS
buginformation.description: This patch covers 3 tests checking CTAS operations against blobstore filesystems. The tests check we can create a table with a CTAS statement from another table, for the source-target combinations blobtore-blobstore, blobstore-hdfs, hdfs-blobstore, and for two target tables, one in the same default database as the source, and another in a new database.

buginformation.summary: LLAP: Llap IO codepath not getting invoked due to file column id mismatch
buginformation.description: LLAP IO codepath is not getting invoked in certain cases when schema evolution checks are done. Though "int --> long" (fileType to readerType) conversions are allowed, the file type columns are not matched correctly when such conversions need to happen.

buginformation.summary: Allow ALL set quantifier with aggregate functions
buginformation.description: SQL:2011 allows <set quantifier> ALL with aggregate functions which is equivalent to aggregate function without ALL.

buginformation.summary: LLAP: send out container complete messages after a fragment completes
BloomFilter expectedEntries not always using NDV when it's available during runtime filtering
buginformation.description: The current logic only uses NDV if it's the only ColumnStat available, but it looks like there can sometimes be other ColStats in the semijoin Select operator.

buginformation.summary: SHOW COMPACTIONS should display CompactionID
buginformation.description: together with HIVE-13353 it will let users search for specific job

buginformation.summary: Upgrade to Datanucleus 4.2.12
buginformation.description: As described in HIVE-14698, the datanucleus-rdbms package that we have currently (4.1.7) has a bug which generates incorrect synatx for MS SQL Server. The bug has been fixed in later releases. HIVE-14698 was a workaround for hive, but since DN has the fix in its 4.2.x line, we should pick it from there. Link to DN releases: https://sourceforge.net/projects/datanucleus/files/datanucleus-accessplatform/. We'll be upgrading the relevant jars in hive to their corresponding versions present in datanucleus-accessplatform v4.2.12

buginformation.summary: Determine when dynamic runtime filtering should be disabled
buginformation.description: Currently dynamic min/max/bloom optimization is always enabled. However there are times where it may not be beneficial, such as if the semijoin has a PK-FK relation and there are no filters on the semijoin table. Try to devise a way to do a cost/benefit calculation to see if there is enough benefit to adding the runtime filter.

buginformation.summary: No need for ConditionalTask if no conditional map join is created
Column pruner should continue to work when SEL has more than 1 child
Beeline user HS2 connection file should use /etc/hive/conf instead of /etc/conf/hive
buginformation.description: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/HiveServer2+Clientssays: BeeLine looks for it in ${HIVE_CONF_DIR} location and /etc/conf/hive in that order.shouldn't it be?BeeLine looks for it in ${HIVE_CONF_DIR} location and /etc/hive/conf in that order?Most distributions I've used have a /etc/hive/conf dir.

buginformation.summary: Create table as select does not check ownership of the location

denied: Principal [name=userx, type=USER] does not have following privileges for operation CREATETABLE [[OBJECT OWNERSHIP] on Object [type=DFS_URI, name=hdfs://hacluster/tmp/foo]] buginformation.summary: Exclude hadoop related classes for JDBC stabdalone jar
Vectorization: unload old hashtables before reloadHashTable
buginformation.description: @Override protected void reloadHashTable(byte pos, int partitionId) throws IOException, HiveException, SerDeException, ClassNotFoundException { // The super method will reload a hash table partition of one of the small tables. // Currently, for native vector map join it will only be one small table. super.reloadHashTable(pos, partitionId); MapJoinTableContainer smallTable = spilledMapJoinTables[pos]; vectorMapJoinHashTable = VectorMapJoinOptimizedCreateHashTable.createHashTable(conf, smallTable); needHashTableSetup = true; LOG.info("Created " + vectorMapJoinHashTable.getClass().getSimpleName() + " from " + this.getClass().getSimpleName()); if (isLogDebugEnabled) { LOG.debug(CLASS_NAME + " reloadHashTable!"); } }The super call causes an OOM because of existing memory usage by vectorMapJoinHashTable.

buginformation.summary: Druid Ser/Des need to use dimension output name
buginformation.description: Druid Ser/Desr need to use dimension output name in order to function with Extraction function.Some part of the Ser/Desr code uses the method DimensionSpec.getDimension() although when extraction function are in game the name of the dimension will be defined by DimensionSpec.getOutputName()

buginformation.summary: HoS should populate split related configurations to HiveConf
buginformation.description: There are several split related configurations, such as MAPREDMINSPLITSIZE, MAPREDMINSPLITSIZEPERNODE, MAPREDMINSPLITSIZEPERRACK, etc., that should be populated to HiveConf. Currently we only do this for MAPREDMINSPLITSIZE.All the others, if not set, will be using the default value, which is 1.Without these, Spark sometimes will not merge small files for file formats such as text.

buginformation.summary: Enable outputName for RS operator in explain formatted
ACID: Make HouseKeeperService threads daemon
Modify schematool scripts to initialize and create METASTORE_DB_PROPERTIES table
buginformation.description: sub-task to modify schema tool and its related changes so that the new table is added to the schema when schematool initializes or upgrades the schema.

buginformation.summary: Vectorization: Specialize ReduceSink empty key case
buginformation.description: Gopal pointed out that native Vectorization of ReduceSink is missing the empty key case.

buginformation.summary: StringBuffer v.s. StringBuilder
buginformation.description: Where appropriate, replaced StringBuffer with StringBuilder to remove superfluous synchronization.

buginformation.summary: Add table type information to HMS log notifications
buginformation.description: The DB notifications used by HiveMetaStore should include the table type for all notifications that include table events, such as create, drop and alter table.This would be useful for consumers to identify views vs tables.

buginformation.summary: Vectorization: throwExpandError should be an immediate fatal
buginformation.description: Vectorized hashtable throwExpandError() should not be retried before failing query - it is a deterministic failure (& immediate query failure).

buginformation.summary: CachedStore.get_aggr_stats_for has side affect
buginformation.description: Every get_aggr_stats_for accumulates the stats and propagated to the first partition stats object. It accumulates and gives wrong result in the follow up invocations.

buginformation.summary: ANALYZE TABLE command should check columns in partition spec
buginformation.description: ANALYZE TABEL PARTITION (col1, col2,...) should check whether col1, col2 etc are partition columns.

buginformation.summary: LLAP IO: enable SMB join in elevator after the former is fixed
buginformation.description: We currently skip the IO elevator when we encounter an SMB join (see HIVE-16761). However, it might work with elevator with the code commented out in HIVE-16761. Need to look again after HIVE-16965 is fixed.

buginformation.summary: Ensure REPL DUMP and REPL LOAD are authorized properly
buginformation.description: Currently, we piggyback REPL DUMP and REPL LOAD on EXPORT and IMPORT auth privileges. However, work is on to not populate all the relevant objects in inputObjs and outputObjs, which then requires that REPL DUMP and REPL LOAD be authorized at a higher level, and simply require ADMIN_PRIV to run,

buginformation.summary: Fix boolean flag switchup in DropTableEvent
buginformation.description: When dropping a non-existent database, the HMS will still fire registered DROP_DATABASE event listeners. This results in an NPE when the listeners attempt to deref the null database parameter.

buginformation.summary: distribute by and sort by ignored in the case of select *
buginformation.description: create table tab1(col1 string, col2 string)select * from tab1 distribute by col1 sort by col2is different from:select col1, col2 from tab1 distribute by col1 sort by col2

buginformation.summary: Create metastore specific configuration tool
buginformation.description: As part of making the metastore a separately releasable module we need configuration tools that are specific to that module. It cannot use or extend HiveConf as that is in hive common. But it must take a HiveConf object and be able to operate on it.The best way to achieve this is using Hadoop's Configuration object (which HiveConf extends) together with enums and static methods.

buginformation.summary: Create separate module for stand alone metastore
buginformation.description: We need to create a separate maven module for the stand alone metastore.

buginformation.summary: Move RegexSerDe out of hive-contrib and over to hive-serde
buginformation.description: RegexSerDe is as much a part of the standard Hive distribution as the other SerDescurrently in hive-serde. I think we should move it over to the hive-serde module so thatusers don't have to go to the added effort of manually registering the contrib jar beforeusing it.

buginformation.summary: Improve miscellaneous error messages
buginformation.description: This is a place for accumulating error message improvements so that we can update a bunch in batch.

buginformation.summary: Add unit test to "alter view" replication
buginformation.description: Adding a unit test to HIVE-17354 change.

buginformation.summary: Exclude avatica-core.jar dependency from avatica shaded jar
buginformation.description: avatica.jar is included in the project but this jar has a dependency on avatica-core.jar and it's pulled into the project as well. If avatica-core.jar is included in the classpath in front of avatica.jar, then hive could run into missing class which is shaded inside avatica.jar.

buginformation.summary: Refactor and add new tests
http-generic-click-jacking for WebHcat server
buginformation.description: The web UIs do not include the "X-Frame-Options" header to prevent the pages from being framed from another site.Reference:https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Clickjackinghttps://www.owasp.org/index.php/Clickjacking_Defense_Cheat_Sheethttps://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/X-Frame-Options

buginformation.summary: Allow specifying custom input and output format in CREATE TABLE
Added restriction to historic queries on web UI
buginformation.description: The HiveServer2 Web UI (HIVE-12550) shows recently completed queries. However, a user can see the queries run by other users as well, and that is a security/privacy concern.Only admin users should be allowed to see queries from other users (similar to behavior of display for configs, stack trace etc).

buginformation.summary: incorrect isRepeating handling in decimal reader in ORC
expose Hive keywords
buginformation.description: This could be useful e.g. for BI tools (via ODBC/JDBC drivers) to decide on SQL capabilities of Hive

buginformation.summary: Fix the test failure for TestCliDriver#vector_complex_join
buginformation.description: The test result miss the info about bigTableKeyExpressions & bigTableValueExpressions

buginformation.summary: SMB Join : Fix the unit tests to run SMB Joins.
buginformation.description: Most of the SMB Join tests are actually not creating SMB Joins. Need them to test the intended join.

buginformation.summary: create resource plan allows duplicates
buginformation.description: Create resource plan allows duplicates. This was seen in a cluster:+----------+-----------+--------------------+| rp_name | status | query_parallelism |+----------+-----------+--------------------+| plan_2 | ACTIVE | 10 || plan_2 | DISABLED | NULL |+----------+-----------+--------------------+

buginformation.summary: Fix spark smb tests
buginformation.description: seems to me that TestSparkCliDriver#testCliDriver[auto_sortmerge_join_10] and TestSparkCliDriver#testCliDriver[bucketsortoptimize_insert_7] is failing since HIVE-18208 is in.

buginformation.summary: Task-cleanup task should be disabled
buginformation.description: Currently when task fails, a cleanup attempt will be scheduled right after that.This is unnecessary and increase the latency. MapReduce will allow disabling this (see MAPREDUCE-2206).After that patch is committed, we should set the JobConf in HIVE to disable cleanup task.

buginformation.summary: Renew the Kerberos ticket used by Druid Query runner
buginformation.description: Druid Http Client has to renew the current user Kerberos ticket when it is close to expire.

buginformation.summary: Ensure git gc finished in ptest prep phase before copying repo
buginformation.description: In ptest's prep phase script first we checkout the latest Hive code from git, and then we make copy of its contents (along .git folder) for that will serve as Yetus' working directory.In some cases we can see errors such as+ cp -R . ../yetuscp: cannot stat ?./.git/gc.pid?: No such file or directorye.g. hereThis is caused by git running its gc feature in the background when our prep script has already started copying. In cases where gc finishes while cp is running, we'll get this error

buginformation.summary: IOW + DP is broken for insert-only ACID
Upgrade Derby to 10.14.1.0
insert DML event may attempt to calculate a checksum on directories
buginformation.description: Looks like in union case, some code path may pass directories in newFiles. Probably legacy copyData/moveData; both seem to assume that these paths are files, but do not actually enforce it.

buginformation.summary: Make partition clause optional for INSERT
buginformation.description: Partition clause should be optional for INSERT INTO VALUES INSERT OVERWRITE INSERT SELECT

buginformation.summary: Fix reoptimization in case of DPP and Semijoin optimization
buginformation.description: reported by t3rmin4t0rIn case dynamic partition pruning; the operator statistics became partial; to only reflect the actually scanned partitions; but they are being used as an information about the "full" table...which leads to the exchange of the 2 tables being joined...which is really unfortunate...

buginformation.summary: Add tests for materialized view rewriting with composite aggregation functions
Masking and filtering policies for materialized views
buginformation.description: Implement masking and filtering policies for materialized views.

buginformation.summary: Intern table descriptors from spark task
buginformation.description: Table descriptors from MR tasks and Tez tasks are interned. This fix is to intern table desc from spark tasks as well.

buginformation.summary: In HPL/SQL, declare statement does not support variable of type character
buginformation.description: In the following HPL/SQL programs:DECLARE a character(5); SET a = 'b';when the type of variable 'a' is CHARACTER, it cannot be assigned a value successfully. The support for the character type should be added to DECLARE statement.

buginformation.summary: For HPL/SQL that contains boolean expression with NOT, incorrect SQL may be generated.
buginformation.description: In HPL/SQL, ' SELECT * FROM a WHERE NOT (1 = 2) ' will generate to incorrect SQL ' SELECT * FROM a WHERE (1 = 2) ', the 'NOT' in boolean expression is missing.

buginformation.summary: Make metastore DB backward compatible with pre-catalog versions of hive.
buginformation.description: Since the addition of foreign key constraint between Database ('DBS') table and catalogs ('CTLGS') table inHIVE-18755 we are unable to run a simple create database command with an older version of Metastore Server. This is due to older versions having JDO schema as per older schema of 'DBS' which did not have an additional 'CTLG_NAME' column.The error is as follows:org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.metadata.HiveException: MetaException(message:Exception thrown flushing changes to datastore)....java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Cannot add or update a child row: a foreign key constraint fails ("metastore_1238"."DBS", CONSTRAINT "CTLG_FK1" FOREIGN KEY ("CTLG_NAME") REFERENCES "CTLGS" ("NAME"))

buginformation.summary: enable session pool by default
buginformation.description: Non pooled session may leak when the client doesn't close the connection.

buginformation.summary: Enable fast serialization in xprod edge
buginformation.description: select count(*) from store_sales, store, customer, customer_address where ss_store_sk = s_store_sk and s_market_id=10 and ss_customer_sk = c_customer_sk and c_birth_country <> upper(ca_country);This uses "org/apache/hadoop/io/serializer/WritableSerialization" instead of TezBytesWritableSerialization.

buginformation.summary: Query-based compaction omits database
buginformation.description: E.g. MM major compaction query looks like:insert into tmp_table select * from src_table;it should beinsert into tmp_table select * from src_db.src_table;Therefore compaction fails if db of source table isn't default.

buginformation.summary: Test sort_acid should be run by TestMiniLlapLocalCliDriver only
TopNKey related tests should be run by TestMiniLlapLocalCliDriver only
buginformation.description: TopNKey optimization is only used when the execution framework is Tez.

buginformation.summary: Upgrade Apache parent POM to version 23
Read Ranger Configs from Classpath
Support automatic rebuilding of indexes when they go stale
buginformation.description: Support a mode where indexes will be automatically rebuilt when the table/partition they are based on is modified. So if index foo is built on table bar, and bar has it's contents overwritten, we should support a mode where index foo will automatically rebuild itself.

buginformation.summary: Add PRINTF() Udf
